title: One Pot Tortellini Bake Recipe
description: This delicious tortellini bake with tomato sauce and cheese is cooked all in one pot.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. Tortellini Recipes One Pot Tortellini Bake 4.8 (12) 7 Reviews 3 Photos This main dish comes together in under an hour and the best part, it cooks in one pot. Serve with crusty garlic bread and a nice green salad if desired. Submitted by thedailygourmet Published on September 20, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 1 pound ground beef 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning ½ teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon granulated garlic 1 (28 ounce) jar marinara sauce 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes 1 cup water ¼ cup Cabernet Sauvignon (or other dry red wine) 1 (16 ounce) package tortellini 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, cubed 4 ounces shredded mozzarella cheese Directions Heat a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook until brown and crumbly, 5 to 10 minutes. Add Italian seasoning, salt, and granulated garlic; mix to combine. Stir in marinara sauce, diced tomatoes with liquid, water, and red wine until well combined. Reduce heat to low; add tortellini and cook until warmed through, about 10 to 15 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Add cream cheese to tortellini mixture and stir gently to blend; sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the surface. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and golden brown, about 15 minutes. Serve immediately. Add Your Photo Photos of One Pot Tortellini Bake 01 of 03 Photo by  thedailygourmet 02 of 03 Photo by  Bonnie Schneider 12/22/2024 This was so simple and absolutely delicious!! Was a huge hit. I doubled the recipe and added fresh spinach. 03 of 03 Photo by  Danielle K 11/12/2022 This was wonderful. Its almost like a tortellini lasagna. 1 You’ll Also Love Creamy Gochujang Tortellini 2 Ratings Creamy Mushroom Tortellini Alfredo 9 Ratings Instant Pot Chicken Tortellini Soup 2 Ratings Steak and Mushroom Tortellini Alfredo 4 Ratings Tortellini Lasagna Skillet 2 Ratings Creamy Tortellini Soup 8 Ratings Steak Tortellini Alfredo Creamy Tortellini Soup with Spinach and Boursin 2 Ratings Cheesy Baked Tortellini 14 Ratings Tortellini alla Fini 4 Ratings Bacon White Cheddar Pesto Mac and Cheese 25 Ratings Sauce Rosee 308 Ratings One-Pot Chili Mac and Cheese 183 Ratings Cheese Tortellini with Italian Sausage and Mushroom-Spinach Cream Sauce 1 Rating Absolutely Fabulous Portobello Mushroom Tortellini 273 Ratings Vegetarian Slow Cooker Meal 67 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: thedailygourmet
instructions: Heat a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook until brown and crumbly, 5 to 10 minutes. Add Italian seasoning, salt, and granulated garlic; mix to combine.;Stir in marinara sauce, diced tomatoes with liquid, water, and red wine until well combined. Reduce heat to low; add tortellini and cook until warmed through, about 10 to 15 minutes.;Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).;Add cream cheese to tortellini mixture and stir gently to blend; sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the surface.;Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and golden brown, about 15 minutes. Serve immediately.
